properties.name: Wolf Children
properties.description: Wolf Children (Japanese: おおかみこどもの雨と雪) is a 2012 Japanese anime drama film directed and co-written by Mamoru Hosoda. The story's depicts 13 years in the life of a young woman, Hana, who falls in love with a werewolf while in college, and following his death must raise the resulting half-wolf half-human siblings, Ame and Yuki, who grow and find their own paths in life. In total, Wolf Children grossed 4.2 billion yen, making it the fifth-highest-grossing movie in Japan in 2012.

properties.name: Hitotsubashi University (一橋大学)
properties.description: The university is where Hana and the wolf man studied and met for the first time. Said to be based on the real-life Hitotsubashi University in Tokyo, Japan.

properties.name: Hana's farmhouse (おおかみこどもの花の家)
properties.description: The farmhouse where Hana, Yuki, and Ame lived together. Based on the real-life farmhouse in Kamiichi-machi.
